data.title: Almost Spring: The top 8 events in Jerusalem
data.meta_description: In honor of Israel Science Day, the museum is opening its doors and inviting you to an afternoon and evening full of activities, workshops, lectures, tours, performances, and more.
data.text:
GO Free

Israel Science Day 2018 at the Bloomfield Science Museum

In honor of Israel Science Day, the museum is opening its doors and inviting you to an afternoon and evening full of activities, workshops, lectures, tours, performances, and more. Thursday | March 15 | Free entrance between 14:00-20:00

GO Culture

Soul Food – Festive Encounters between Food and Text at Beit Avi Chai

Professor Avigdor Shenan lectures on the different Jewish sources connected to the Passover Seder and Efrat Lichtenstadt, food columnist for Makor Rishon and author of the blog “What do you do all day?,” focuses on how to create a deliciously festive pavlova dessert. Monday | March 19 | 20:00

Working on Relationships: Sketches at the Jerusalem Theater

Every home is filled with the raw material of humor, which lies in the small details revealed here through reconstructed writing and amusing critique. Yossi Marshek and Lilianne Barto hold up a mirror to the audience with surprisingly funny results. Wednesday | March 21 | 21:00

Journeys and Haggadahs: Passover at the National Library

Which Haggadah was put in geniza shortly after it was published? How was the journey of the people of Israel through the desert portrayed in ancient maps? And what is the connection between a 17th century Christian preacher and the famous Amsterdam Haggadah? Monday and Wednesday | March 26 and 28 | 18:00

GO Kids

Story Hour at the Bible Lands Museum

How was day created? And who is in charge of night? And what does the lotus flower mean? Come hear about gods, snakes, good and evil, and the answers to the questions above in this telling of the Egyptian story of creation. Wednesday | March 21 | 16:45

Peter and the Wolf at Beit Schmuel

Beloved actor and storyteller Hani Nachmias gives a fresh, light-hearted take on the classic tale of Peter and the Wolf, with new, original songs. Saturday | March 24 | 11:00

GO Tours

Journey through the Map” Tours at the Tower of David Museum

Explore Jerusalem by following ancient maps of the city and learn who created them and how the city looked through their eyes. Fridays in March and April

Segway Jerusalem

Join us for this unique experience that glides you past the city’s most breathtaking sites. Tours are for couples and groups and include fascinating explanations and little known details from Jerusalem’s singular past.
